At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation. As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation. Position Overview: Are you a seasoned software engineer, eager to break into the fast paced fields of data science and machine learning? Are you proficient in Python, and full life cycle software development? Freddie Mac is currently seeking a senior developer to join the Credit Innovation and Analytics team in the Single-Family division! This position will play an important role in developing, enhancing and maintaining CIA’s suite of applications, models and tools used for automated evaluation of borrowers’ capacity (assets, income, employment). The person will employ strong software development and analytical skills in the implementation of new products and optimization/ expansion of existing products. *** This position can be performed from a remote location   in the U.S.*** Our Impact: The CIA team owns credit policy and analytics as it pertains to the borrower’s capacity to repay the mortgage. The team is responsible for developing and implementing technical solutions for automating the manual processes of assessing borrower assets and income using big data, analytics and third-party service providers. Your Impact: Your work will primarily involve analytic software design, development and maintenance: Model, implement and test business rules in complex analytics software involving machine learning and data analysis algorithms. Use standard methodologies in software development to create and maintain scalable, robust, reliable, maintainable and elegant software. Work with the business analysts to translate business requirements into software specifications, Develop automated testing strategies and tools, conduct testing, and present results. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5+years experience in developing analytic and production quality software, following industry standard methodologies. Hands on experience in well disciplined, full stack and full life cycle software development. Proficiency in Python, C++ and Java. Fluency in development tools such as Make, Git, shell scripts, gdb, pdb, SQL, RDBMS Keys to Success in this Role: Demonstrate superior technical skills, Ability to collaborate across multiple teams Keep pace with rapidly changing business needs. Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site. Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others. Description: The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy leader with a working knowledge in artificial intelligence and machine learning to lead and grow the internal AI Consulting and Aimlabs portfolio for the business. In this role you will be part of the AI Foundations directorate consisting of colleagues possessing varying skill sets including: front-end and back-end developers, data engineers, machine learning / AI specialists, product managers, and other data scientists. The selected candidate will focus on the AI Consulting team and Aimlabs portfolio’s but will be included as part of a broader range of projects across the LAIC . The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative, and agile teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin enterprise.  Responsibilities of this role will include:  Establish the strategy and vision for both the AI Consulting and Aimlabs portfolios. Execute strategy to create tangible business value for Lockheed Martin Setting vision and priorities for AI Consulting team, including support of day-to-day leadership, architecting complex solutions, and solving complex AI/ML challenges for Lockheed Martin business areas Develop internal and external business relationships to grow the AI Consulting portfolio that provides measurable business value. Consultation and mentoring around the corporation on a variety of topics including MLOps best practices, team building, and solving technical challenges at enterprise scale Establish the strategy and priorities for Aimlabs and AI training teams focused on connecting the LM AI community, major internal AI conferences, workforce training and developer advocacy Integrate with HR and corporate functions to define plan for AI/ML training enterprise wide. Develop strategy and plan for upskilling thousands of Lockheed employees to prepare them for AI/ML tasks. Integration across AI Foundations and the AI Factory team, the LAIC and IT to ensure a OneLM approach to Lockheed’s foundational AI ecosystem to develop 21 century capabilities for our Customers and internal business operations  Implementing best technical practices from the fields of machine learning and software engineering. Identifying tooling gaps on the team and working to fill those gaps. Hiring and mentoring team members. Spreading best practices of the team to other data science teams at Lockheed Martin by creating knowledge materials, presenting those materials, and engaging with other data science leaders on those materials. Domestic travel will be required.  MUST BE A US CITIZEN.  Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Experience in Engineering and Program Management. job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Finance Data Analytics - Remote
job_Description: Job Locations: US-VA-Smithfield Your Opportunity: As a Senior Data Analyst in the Finance Data Analytics department, you will be responsible for maintaining, improving, and building new reporting capabilities for cross-functional areas of the business. By developing a deep understanding of operational processes and needs, you will be responsible for implementing new reporting capabilities and using technology to deliver impactful reports. You will partner with teams in various functional areas of the business and will implement process improvements to streamline the efficiency and accuracy of the reporting process. You will be responsible for delivering daily, weekly, and monthly reports accurately and on time. You will also be involved in ad hoc analysis of large datasets to quickly provide insight into the business. Employee will have the capacity to work  90-95% remote. Core Responsibilities: Function as an analytics and reporting expert for assigned functions by developing standard reports and designing, running and maintaining ad hoc queries. Develop reports, metrics, models, scorecards, and dashboards by gathering data and transforming it into stories and insights that drive business recommendations and decision-making. Publish daily, weekly, and monthly reports accurately and on time Build reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI, Analysis for Office, Bex, and other reporting tools Build automated processes using scripting tools Hold training sessions on how to use the various tools and reports created by the department Generate load files for various systems, maintaining system accuracy Communicate effectively with report stake holders to ensure strong understanding of the methodology behind all calculations Perform ad hoc analysis using data from various systems and explain results of analysis to all levels of management Create SOPs and maintain documentation for processes Demonstrate continuous efforts to improve processes, increase data integrity, and provide quality customer service to our business partners. Provide comprehensive analytical and fact-based reporting to support and/or identify opportunities to impact operational results, make changes to processes, and support strategic initiatives. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions . Bachelor's Degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university in Accounting/Finance, Computer Science/Data Analytics or related field and 5+ years of relevant work experience, or equivalent combination of education and/or experience, required. Ability to build models using advanced features of Excel. Strong experience with Power BI / Tableau, Power Pivot, SAP, SAP Analysis for Office, BPC, Bex Query Designer. Strong Experience in analyzing data within relational database systems such as MS Access, MS SQL Server, and MySQL. Experience with ETL Tools such as Alteryx, Paxata, DataGuru or equivalent technologies, preferred. Understanding of Windows environment command line tools, .BAT files, and Task Scheduler, preferred. Experience with HTML/CSS/Javascript and a backend technology like python-flask, preferred. Experience with Data analysis in Python using Pandas/Numpy/Jupyter Notebooks, preferred. Ability to quickly learn new technology and business logic. Superior analytical and problem-solving skills with superb attention to detail. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing and ambiguous environment. Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment. Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment. Up to 10% travel required. Careers and Benefits: To learn more about Smithfield’s benefits, visit smithfieldfoods.com/careerbenefits.  PEOPLE MATTER More than 63,000 employees globally drive our success. We strive to create a fair, ethical and rewarding work environment.  GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT Working at Smithfield isn't just a job – it's the foundation for a lifelong career with training designed to help you advance professionally.  BENEFITS Our people matter. That's why we offer excellent, comprehensive benefits packages to our full-time employees.  SUSTAINABILITY PLEDGE Sustainability is ingrained in our culture and guides how we operate. We believe in innovating for the future.  About Smithfield Foods: Headquartered in Smithfield, Va. since 1936, Smithfield Foods, Inc. is an American food company with agricultural roots and a global reach. Our 40,000 U.S. and 15,000 European employees are dedicated to producing "Good food. Responsibly.®" and have made us one of the world's leading vertically integrated protein companies. We have pioneered sustainability standards for more than two decades, including many industry firsts, such as our ambitious commitment to cut our carbon impact by 25 percent by 2025. We believe in the power of protein to end food insecurity and have donated hundreds of millions of food servings to our neighbors in need. Smithfield boasts a portfolio of high-quality iconic brands, such as Smithfield®, Eckrich® and Nathan's Famous®, among many others. For more information, visit www.smithfieldfoods.com, and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram. EEO/AA Information: Smithfield is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, gender identity, protected veterans status, status as a disabled individual or any other protected group status or non-job characteristic as directed by law.

job_title: AAS Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst - Data Engineer
job_Description: Travel Required:  Less than 10%  Public Trust:  None  Requisition Type:  Regular  What You’ll Get to Do: As an Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst, you will provide analytical support to our government client and forward deployed units. You will focus on countering improvised threats and the networks that finance, build, or employ such threats. Duties will include providing large-scale advanced analytics support; collecting, parsing, transforming, and integrating relevant data in support of projects; and providing operational, systems, and intelligence analysis to support the mission. More About the Role: You will apply your expertise to provide data supporting strategic and operational requests from deployed and deploying units. These data may be used to: assist decision makers with risk assessments, prioritization, and/or to provide leadership with quantitative organizational assessments to support functional evaluations. You will develop, document, implement, and automate ETL (extract transform load) processes using SQL® and other analytical programming tools that most efficiently import structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from new and/or dynamic data sources, ensuring data validity, reliability, and availability to users. You will collaborate with team members to ensure retrieval of information pertinent to current work and timely dissemination of counter asymmetric threat products. You’ll Bring These Qualifications: Masters in a technical discipline plus three (3) years of experience; or Bachelors in a technical field plus five (5) years of experience. Significant programming experience in SQL® (including VBA, and macro). Significant experience programming in at least one other programming language (Python, R, Perl, C++) Current Top Secret/Specialized Compartmented Information Security Clearance. The ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing. These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:  SQL Certified Programmer certificate prior to employment. Degree in one of the following disciplines: Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics. Experience using Python libraries including pandas, scipy, numpy, matplotlib, requests, or similar libraries in another programming language. Knowledge of how to utilize business intelligence tools and processes that improve readability of and access to data, through the creation of stored/scheduled processes and effective visualization. Ability to create complex programs that ingest, parse, clean, transform, and analyze large (millions of records) datasets; to apply mathematical and statistical models to real-world data, and; to deliver analytical results through written and oral presentations. Prior experience utilizing ETL software (e.g., PowerCenter, Pentaho, PLSQL), Business Intelligence software (e.g., SAS® BI, Oracle BI, Cognos, Business Objects), or Geospatial Information Systems (GIS) software (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS® suite) is preferred. Experience interacting with “big data” systems such as Hadoop or Amazon Web Services (AWS). Experience using Alteryx Designer to build/manage workflows. Prior experience as an all-source intelligence analyst or ORSA Prior experience with Counter UAS operations.  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: To protect the health and safety of its employees and to comply with customer requirements, GDIT may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.  We are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done.  GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

location: 1919 North Lynn Street Suite 1500, Rosslyn, VA 22209
job_Description: In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.  Work you'll do  Deloitte is looking for a Data Analytics Manager to lead the development of data management and the development of the processes and scripts required to transform and stage data necessary to develop products and conduct statistical analyses. Individuals are responsible for providing support to our clients to aid in their data management from ingestion through exploitation. The candidates may also be responsible for exploring and implementing new data enhancement tools and methodologies. The Data Specialist will work within database design, data management, data pipelining, and ETL practices.  The team  Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.  The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.  Qualifications  Required:  Bachelor's degree required Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future 10+ years experience in Data Engineering, Reporting, and/or Metadata management 3+ years experience with data governance tools (OvalEdge, Collibra, Talend, etc.) Expertise in health research, healthcare, bioinformatics and/or public health fields   Preferred:    Critical thinker who asks questions, digs-in, comes to new conclusions based on the findings Excellent communication skills: comfortable and experienced communicating to senior management and colleagues across functional areas Strong stakeholder management capabilities with key focus on delivery and client orientation   How you'll grow  At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Job Description: Job Title:  Statistical Analyst Location:  Reston, VA. Per Executive Order 14042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment. About This Role: Comscore is seeking a Statistical Analyst with experience in Data Science and large data sets focusing on data sampling and analysis. In this role, you will serve as a primary owner of the sampling and projection methodology for reporting Comscores panel data and will be a key point of contact for questions and issues that arise around data production. You will be a key resource for daily, weekly and monthly production tasks and will develop a thorough understanding of our sampling and weights-generation process.   What You'll Do: Support the Comscore teams by providing in-depth knowledge of the weights-generation process and field questions that arise about methodology or data. Investigate potential data issues found in Comscores syndicated reports and work efficiently with other internal departments to get problems resolved, propose solutions and implement future safeguards. Develop and implement new or improved processes for sample selection and projection. Maintain a sound understanding of the market, methodology, and technology that make up each of the products within the product suite. Become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for client presentation methodology regarding projections and weights What You'll Need: Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative subject such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, etc. along with 1-3 years of professional experience in data analysis and problem solving with big data. Strong Data Science skills that include analysis design/execution, data analysis and problem solving with large amounts of data. High level of understanding of Mathematical and Statistical Concepts. Technical Skills: Python/PySpark (Pandas, NumPy), BASE SAS , Hadoop, SQL functions and Queries Management Skills: Autonomously manage simultaneous projects and tasks, be accountable and time management Communication: Self-motivated for asking questions and reaching out to team members. Experience with Internet Market Research data or panel-based data is a plus About Comscore:  Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms.  With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry’s emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. To comply with federal law, Comscore participates in E-Verify. Successful candidates must pass the E-Verify process after hire. LI-DB1

job_title: Data Engineer - Level I (Active Secret Clearance Required)
job_Description: Data Engineer (Level I)  Redhorse Corporation is building a cross-functional team to support the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center (JAIC) within the Department of Defense (DoD). We will help our customer accelerate the delivery AI-enabled capabilities, scale Department-wide impact of AI, and synchronize AI activities to expand customer advantages. Our team will enable the DoD to seamlessly build, deploy, and operate machine learning solutions for DoD-level problems.  Position Description  Redhorse Corporation is currently seeking a  Data Engineer – Level I  to join our team to provide Systems Engineering and Technical Services (SETA) to the Joint Artificial Center (JAIC) Missions Directorate. The Missions Directorate is tasked with direction / synchronization of efforts to modernize the DoD with AI. The work location for this position is in the National Capital Region (NCR) with the possibility of up to 25% travel.  Major Duties for the Data Engineer – Level I include but are not limited to:  Support the configuration and ingestion of designated structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data repositories into capabilities that satisfy mission partner requirements and support a data analytics and DevOps pipeline to drive rapid delivery of functionality to the client.  Maintain all operational aspects of data transfers while accounting for the security posture of the underlying infrastructure and the systems and applications that are supported and monitoring the health of the environment through a variety of health tracking capabilities.  Automate configuration management, leverage tools, and stay current on data extract, transfer, and load (ETL) technologies and services.  Work under general guidance, demonstrate an initiative to develop approaches to solutions independently, review architecture, and identify areas for automation, optimization, right-sizing, and cost reduction to support the overall health of the environment.  Apply comprehension of data engineering-specific technologies and services, leverage expertise in databases and a variety of approaches to structuring and retrieving of data, comprehend Cloud architectural constructs, and support the establishment and maintenance of Cloud environments programmatically using vendor consoles.  Engage with multiple functional groups to comprehend client challenges, prototype new ideas and new technologies, help to create solutions to drive the next wave of innovation, and design, implement, schedule, test, and deploy full features and components of solutions.  Identify and implement scalable and efficient coding solutions.  Minimum Basic Requirements for Skills, Experience, Education and Credentials include:  Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related field  A range of less than 4 years of relevant work experience  Experience with natural processing language (NLP) model or deep learning (DL) model building  Experience with two or more coding languages, including Python.  Extensive knowledge of machine learning model evaluation metrics and best practices.  An active Secret security clearance is required for this role. Jobseekers who do not possess an active Secret security clearance will not be considered.  Executive Order Requirement:  In accordance with Executive Order 14042 as a Federal Contractor Redhorse requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 by December 8, 2021 or prior to the first date of employment, whichever is later. As required by the Executive Order, Redhorse will work in coordination with applicable contract agencies to consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.  Redhorse Corporation shall, in its discretion, modify or adjust the position to meet Redhorse’s changing needs.  This job description is not a contract and may be adjusted as deemed appropriate in Redhorse’s sole discretion.  EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

Supporting the Most Exciting and Meaningful Missions in the World  Statistician  PAE is currently seeking a Statistician in Quantico, VA and Huntsville, AL. A successful candidate will conduct statistical analysis and reporting to support forensic processes, examinations, QA, and management. In addition, Statisticians will be required to assist with the review of various documents as they relate to the statistical calculations current and / or to be implemented in the CODIS software. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Analyze and review of statistical calculations for scientific validity, verification, reliability, and accuracy; recommend improvements to calculations and statistics, as appropriate. Analyze and recommend changes to kinship calculations / statistics when using genetically linked STR loci. Analyze and recommend improvements to statistical calculations for mixture analysis. Analyze and recommend improvements to the mutation models used for paternity and kinship calculations. Analyze and recommend a computation / statistic to support threshold-based identity database searches Provide statistical analysis and evaluation of new genetic technologies (e.g. SNPs) Provide recommendations for optimal data presentation (i.e., Microsoft Power Point) Develop training materials through presentation development and / or Computer-Based Training content development. Other support activities / functions / duties as defined / detailed as they arise. Research, develop, and author whitepapers and information papers, as required. Required Qualifications Master’s Degree or Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analysis disciplines, or related fields of study. Twelve (12) years in the field of forensic DNA and population genetics. Specialty in statistics with strong knowledge of forensic DNA and population genetics. Expertise in human Mendelian genetics, population statistics, forensic DNA technologies, computer science, and bioinformatics. Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills The above experience should demonstrate the capability to deliver products under conditions of high operational tempo, frequently adjusting priorities and flux in requirements, on time. It should also demonstrate the ability to interface effectively with senior members of external organizations to develop and support technical positions, to justify technical recommendations, and communicate effectively in both oral and written formats. Overview: BigBear.ai  is seeking a  Data Manager  to support to the Air Operations Center Weapon System (AOC WS) program, which is within the Digital Directorate and located at Langley AFB, VA. What you will do: Analyzes current work procedures and implements adjustments for maximum efficiency. Lead the effort to research, and identify how Agile/Scrum principles integrate into the ongoing work efforts—designed framework for local leadership. Authors and manages currency of Configuration Management Plans (CMP) for Sustainment and EMD programs; researched and revamped documents to include data engineering, data integration, data quality, and security. Applies knowledge of concepts of evolutionary acquisition, spiral development/delivery, and incremental development to new processes under development for acquiring new AOC weapon system capabilities. Continuous interface with Northrop Grumman (NG) MA to improve the Quality, CM, and DM programs to allow better synergy, harmony and situational awareness of related tasks. Provides strategic guidance based on Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats analysis to ensure transformational changes for cross-functional teams— a new standard set for the delivery of products and services across the entire enterprise. Coordinates, reviews, and assess Basis of Estimate for man-hour proposals for mission assurance, configuration/data management, and quality assurance relationship builder. Institutes and maintains a database to track Class I/II Enterprise Change Proposals Provides detailed EMD CM requirements and associated Technical Specification Guide for the inclusion of the status accounting tool Change Management Interim Tool (CMIT) What you need to have: Clearance: must possess and maintain a Secret Clearance Bachelors degree Experience with JIRA and Confluence systems. Progressive experience in managing configuration of software, engineering documents, design drawings, engineering changes and notices, and planning/conducting design audits. In-depth understanding of the configuration change control process, role of the Change Control Board (CCB), and change control documentation. Demonstrated characteristics of a self-starter who is able to work independently and effectively interact with program team members and senior leadership. Exhibit excellent interpersonal relationships and the ability to work as part of a multi-disciplined team. Possess excellent writing and presentation skills. Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and SharePoint What we'd like you to have: Advanced Degree Previous Data Management experience on a DoD contract About BigBear.ai: A leader in decision dominance for more than 20 years, BigBear.ai operationalizes artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale through its end-to-end data analytics platform. BigBear.ai’s composable AI-powered platform solutions work together as often as they stand alone: Observe (data ingestion and conflation), Orient (composable machine learning at scale), and Dominate (visual anticipatory intelligence and optimization). BigBear.ai’s customers, which include the U.S. Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, the U.S. Federal Government, as well as customers in the commercial sector, rely on BigBear.ai’s high value software products and technology to analyze information, identify and manage risk, and support mission critical decision making. Headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, BigBear.ai has additional locations in Virginia, Massachusetts, Michigan, and California. Description  Job Description: We are seeking a motivated and talented Senior Algorithm Scientist to join our algorithm development team and participate with hands-on contributions to advanced real-time detection, computer vision algorithms, machine learning and supporting software infrastructure. You will be involved in the development of computer vision, image processing, and machine learning algorithms for several for our real-time airport security scanning systems. You will be working on algorithms for 3-d volumetric detection of prohibited items concealed on passengers or in their baggage. We have thousands of scanners in daily operation around the world on which your algorithms will be deployed! Primary Responsibilities Contribute to a team that is developing object detection and image processing system architectures that will be implemented in real-time decision processes in aviation security screening systems fielded across the world. Hands on research and development of advanced image processing / analysis, object detection, machine learning and scene segmentation algorithms. Implement production quality real-time C++ software for sophisticated computer vision and machine learning algorithms; primarily for detecting threat objects in 3-d volumetric x-ray data. Design and implement new algorithms and improve existing algorithms in C++ class structure using good software engineering techniques with emphasis on reusability and efficiency. Train machine learning classifiers with emphasis on classifier generalization. Assist with the development of new machine learning algorithms to improve the detection performance for challenging threats. Analyze data, make recommendations, and write technical reports. Interface with other software teams to integrate algorithms with external software components. May require occasional travel (5%), domestic or international, to assist with data collections as well as support for certification. Basic Qualifications BS/MS in computer science/engineering in a related subject such as data science, computer vision, machine learning, algorithm development including advanced image processing. 12+ years' industry and/or research experience developing algorithms in one or more of the following areas: image/video processing, computer vision, radar, advanced machine learning. 5 years’ experience in image processing techniques (filtering, segmentation, edge detection, object detection). 3 years machine learning classifier development experience. 5 years C++ software development in an engineering product environment. Expert in Matlab / Python with at least 3 years’ experience in algorithm prototyping / development for computer vision. Experience designing machine learning algorithms, including creating software for data loading, training, and inference for novel ML architectures. Experience with product quality software development including profiling and optimizing real-time algorithm runtime. Strong math, analytical and communication skills. Must have positive, team focused attitude and approach to work tasks. Ability to obtain and maintain a US secret security clearance, which requires US Citizenship.  We are unable to sponsor visas for this position and require applicants to be either a US citizen or a permanent resident (Green Card holder). Preferred Qualifications PhD in computer science/engineering in a related subject such as computer vision, machine learning or advanced image processing based algorithm development. 5 years strong understanding of advanced computer vision / image processing / segmentation, pattern recognition, classification. 5 years machine learning classifier development experience including approaches to use data sets to train and validate generalizable classifiers. Experience with Windows and Linux development environments including writing Perl and shell scripts. Basic knowledge of the electromagnetic spectrum (x-ray/radar) and related technologies. Current US secret security clearance. About Us Our St. Pete office is a diverse and collaborative environment, just steps away from white sand beaches ranked #1 in US and Top 5 worldwide by TripAdvisor! We value and support the well-being and mobility of our employees with competitive benefit packages, flexible work arrangements, complementary e-learning training, work-life flexibility, exciting referral programs, and a diverse, inclusive and ethical work place. In fact, in 2021, Leidos was ranked as one of the “World's Most Ethical Companies” by the Ethisphere Institute for the fourth consecutive year. Driven by our talented workforce, the Security Detection and Automation Operation is the cornerstone of Leidos’ comprehensive suite of fully integrated security detection and automation solutions for aviation, ports and borders, and critical infrastructure customers around the world, with more than 24,000 products deployed across 120 countries. Leidos is positioned to address emerging and evolving threats through rapid development of innovative solutions for our global customers Pay Range: Pay Range $113,100.00 - $174,000.00 - $234,900.00 #Remote

At Ball Aerospace, we care about the health and safety of our team members, their families and our communities. Ball Aerospace will comply with Executive Order 14042 should it be reinstated. Powered by endlessly curious people with an unwavering mission focus, Ball Aerospace pioneers discoveries that enable our customers to perform beyond expectation and protect what matters most. We create innovative space solutions, enable more accurate weather forecasts, drive insightful observations of our planet, deliver actionable data and intelligence, and ensure those who defend our freedom go forward bravely and return home safely. Senior Engineer – Mission Data Analyst Join Ball Aerospace’s Payload Systems Engineering team as a Senior Mission Data Analyst Engineer! In this role, you will conduct performance modelling and simulation with a focus on leading the analysis effort for developing, implementing, and applying mission algorithms. NOTE: This position is located in Springfield, Virginia. What You’ll Do: Lead data analysis to characterize sensor functionality and performance. Conduct data exploitation of geospatial data to solve characterization problems; including but not limited to data processing, data analysis, tool development, analytic support, report writing, and presentations. Characterize the performance of remote sensing systems and relate sensor characteristics to the performance of automated and manual detection, classification, and characterization of targets. Perform data analysis using temporal, spatial, and/or spectral processing of EO/IR data. Perform analysis and interpretation of multi and hyperspectral mission data. Design, build, and implement complex algorithms to support missions, payloads, and instruments. Communicate mission level analysis results to internal and external customers. Work closely with program team and stakeholders to develop and demonstrate new capabilities to decision makers. Prepare and give presentations to peers, management, and customers. Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule. Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Support Units and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment. Perform other duties as necessary. What You’ll Need: BS degree or higher in Engineering or a related technical field is required plus 8 or more years related experience. Each higher-level degree, i.e. Master’s degree or Ph.D., may substitute for two years of experience. Related technical experience may be considered in lieu of education. Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education. Experience in mission system, spacecraft systems, ground systems or payloads preferred. Experience with EO/IR/Radar analysis, GIS, data analysis, signal processing, and algorithm development preferred. Experience in spectral analysis and image processing preferred. Ability to rapidly prototype new algorithm results and visualization preferred. Expertise writing code for data analysis with either MATLAB, ENVI/IDL, R, Python, or other similar software applications. Effective presentation skills with experience presenting technical results to senior customers and technical reviewers. Demonstrated ability to work with a geographically diverse team. A current, active TS/SCI security clearance is required. Flexible On-Site Work Environment:  This position requires regular in-person engagement by working on-site for three or more days per work week. Travel and local commute between Ball campuses and other possible non-Ball locations may be required. Working Conditions: Ball Aerospace is a drug-free workplace, which is imperative to the health and safety of all employees and is required as a condition of receiving contracts from federal agencies. Please remember that regardless of the legalization of marijuana in Colorado and other states, possession and use continues to be illegal under the federal Controlled Substances Act. This includes the use of some CBD products. A post-offer, pre-employment drug test is a condition of employment. Work is performed in an office, laboratory, production floor, or cleanroom, outdoors or remote research environment. May occasionally work in production work centers where use of protective equipment and gear is required. May access other facilities in various weather conditions. Verification that your current security clearance or government customer access meets the requirement for this position will be required. Relocation for this position is available. Compensation & Benefits: HIRING SALARY RANGE:  $149,000 - $188,000 (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.) This position includes a competitive benefits package. For details, copy and paste https://bit.ly/3pNSnxv into your browser or visit our careers site. US CITIZENSHIP IS REQUIRED Ball Aerospace is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. #LI-KR1

Overview: LMI is a consultancy dedicated to powering a future-ready, high-performing government, drawing from expertise in digital and analytic solutions, logistics, and management advisory services. We deliver integrated capabilities that incorporate emerging technologies and are tailored to customers’ unique mission needs, backed by objective research and data analysis. Founded in 1961 to help the Department of Defense resolve complex logistics management challenges, LMI continues to enable growth and transformation, enhance operational readiness and resiliency, and ensure mission success for federal civilian and defense agencies. LMI is seeking a  Principal, Health Data Analytics Lead  focused across the Federal Health sector with a demonstrated track record of identifying, qualifying, and winning opportunities. Responsibilities: Leverage experience with consulting in the life sciences or healthcare industry to define business problems and develop analytics solutions with a focus on operationalizing machine learning models and artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. Oversee the development of the firm-wide strategy for Health Analytics and AI, including managing a portfolio of engagements across government clients. Provide thought leadership, drive business growth within the market, and develop and maintain client relationships. Take an active role in the development, mentoring and coaching of a team of data scientists, developers and domain experts. Work to actively enhance the diversity of the firm, and play a lead role in attracting, developing and retaining a world-class team of analytics professionals supporting the firm’s health business. Identify and qualify a Federal Health (HHS, CDC, NIH, CMS) pipeline that aligns with our strategic vision for growth at these agencies. Design, develop, and implement account plans (to articulate and generate consensus for strategic vision, action plan, competitive intelligence, investments, business case, etc.) within the federal health portfolio. Develop and implement call plans to engage customers to identify and shape opportunities. Support Captures and Proposals to maintain continuity across the BD lifecycle, enhancing the ability to win as opportunities pass from qualification into capture and proposal. Collaborate, communicate, and coordinate with all parts of the matrix organization including Communications, Service Lines, CTO, and Enterprise Services to drive growth for the Federal Health sector. Qualifications: 10+ years of experience with analytics delivery in a consulting role, defining strategy, establishing client relationships, and delivering innovative solutions. Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution in either STEM or business related. Experience in the application of data science and advanced data analytics to health/medical use cases, including structured, unstructured, or relational and data mining and machine learning techniques. Experience with applying data visualization techniques to tell the story of the data, leveraging data to inform decision making, risk mining, and structured and unstructured text mining methods and techniques. Existing and current relationship with key Health clients and stakeholders. Experience with developing and mentoring staff at all levels and building an internal capacity to deliver high quality and highly innovative analytics services. Experience with developing and implementing successful market strategy and business development and leading proposal, project, and intellectual capital creation. Experience in project management and client relationship building. Technical and domain expertise of healthcare sector including Health IT, Health Analytics, Health Policy, and overall Healthcare Service Delivery. Understanding of the technologies, solutions, and vendors that are often selected to deliver these capabilities within the federal health domain space. Additional Qualifications: Master’s Degree from an accredited institution in either STEM or business 10+ years performing Business Development (sales, marketing, capture, proposal) activities, with emphasis in healthcare and HHS accounts. Deep technical and domain expertise of healthcare sector including Health IT, Health Analytics, Health Policy, and overall Healthcare Service Delivery. #LI-SH1

Summary:  Yorktown Systems Group is seeking exceptionally qualified individuals to serve as a Data Engineer (Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst). The Asymmetric Threat Analyst provides analytical support to our government client and forward deployed units. You will focus on countering improvised threats and the networks that finance, build, or employ such threats. Duties will include providing large-scale advanced analytics support; collecting, parsing, transforming, and integrating relevant data in support of projects; and providing operational, systems, and intelligence analysis to support the mission.  .  Additional duties may include, but are not limited to:  Provide data supporting strategic and operational requests from deployed and deploying units. These data may be used to: assist decision makers with risk assessments, prioritization, and/or to provide leadership with quantitative organizational assessments to support functional evaluations.  Develop, document, implement, and automate ETL (extract transform load) processes using SQL® and other analytical programming tools that most efficiently import structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from new and/or dynamic data sources, ensuring data validity, reliability, and availability to users.  Collaborate with team members to ensure retrieval of information pertinent to current work and timely dissemination of counter asymmetric threat products.   Required Qualifications:  Current Top Secret/Specialized Compartmented Information Security Clearance.  Master's in a technical discipline plus three (3) years of experience; or Bachelor's in a technical field plus five (5) years of experience.  Significant programming experience in SQL® (including VBA, and macro).  Significant experience programming in at least one other programming language (Python, R, Perl, C++)  The ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing.   Desired Qualifications:   SQL Certified Programmer certificate prior to employment.  Degree in one of the following disciplines: Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.  Experience using Python libraries including pandas, scipy, numpy, matplotlib, requests, or similar libraries in another programming language.  Knowledge of how to utilize business intelligence tools and processes that improve readability of and access to data, through the creation of stored/scheduled processes and effective visualization.  Ability to create complex programs that ingest, parse, clean, transform, and analyze large (millions of records) datasets; to apply mathematical and statistical models to real-world data, and; to deliver analytical results through written and oral presentations.  Prior experience utilizing ETL software (e.g., PowerCenter, Pentaho, PLSQL), Business Intelligence software (e.g., SAS® BI, Oracle BI, Cognos, Business Objects), or Geospatial Information Systems (GIS) software (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS® suite) is preferred.  Experience interacting with “big data” systems such as Hadoop or Amazon Web Services (AWS).  Experience using Alteryx Designer to build/manage workflows.  Prior experience as an all-source intelligence analyst or ORSA  Prior experience with Counter UAS operations.   Clearance: Must possess a TOP SECRET/SCI Clearance   Location:  Reston, VA   Travel:  Some travel maybe required

About this role: The Vice President for Gartner.com Machine Learning and Data Engineering will lead a team responsible for building and maintaining the tools and APIs that power a personalized client experience for the www.gartner.com website. This includes architecting and building recommender and search engines. The ideal candidate will be someone who has experience in artificial intelligence and machine learning. They have built scalable, performant systems on top of these technologies. They should have demonstrable experience innovating with technology to meet business needs. What you’ll do: Manage teams of data engineers and developers that build and maintain recommendation models and apis Define project deliverables, schedules, and testing, launch and release plans Hiring, performance management and career development Define system architecture and technologies What you’ll need: Master/Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent 10+ years of experience in management position leading a teams of engineers Significant experience working directly with Product Development in problem solving Excellent understanding of Database Design and Data Management concepts and Strategies Significant experience building recommender systems Significant experience building search and insight engines Experience supporting highly performant and available web apis with a global client base Experience using cloud based infrastructure Excellent understanding Agile practices and significant experience using Scrum Strong interpersonal and communication skills (oral, written and group presentations) Strong Project Management skills Excellent prioritization skills Who you are: A Technologist, passionate about using technology to solve complex problems A Mentor, someone who will lead their team of developers technically and professionally Collaborative and able to work across teams and organizations Detail oriented and Quality focused Who are we? Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s most critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have nearly 16,000 associates globally that support our 14,000+ clients in more than 100 countries. What makes Gartner a great place to work? Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you. At CCRi, our clients look to us to solve their hardest problems, and we have a long history of exceeding their expectations. With clients in both the private sector and the US government, we provide a variety of advanced analytical techniques, and we render our solutions in software that our clients can apply immediately. The Role You'll help create machine learning analytics that will be integrated into streaming data processing pipelines and appealing user interfaces that provide real-time situational awareness and expose advanced analytics to end users. As a senior data scientist, you will be expected to balance technical responsibilities (design and development) with team responsibilities (technical planning, roadmaps, ticket creation and delegation, mentorship). You’ll likely conduct demos and give presentations, and will be expected to contribute to the data science culture and ecosystem at CCRi through opportunities like design reviews and shared learning opportunities. Who You Are  Curious : You enjoy peeling apart a problem and examining the interrelationships between data and how they can be used to form a solution.  Creative : You try new approaches to solving problems, looking for ways to apply techniques across domains and in new contexts.  Practical : You explore theories with an eye to their real world applications and their potential for improving performance for clients.  Collaborative : You work well on a team and understand how to lead a group of bright, technical coworkers. You can explain your work to your peers and source ideas and improvements from them.  Determined : You enjoy the challenge of finding solutions to difficult problems, testing them to discover what is successful and what should be optimized further, to develop industry-leading tools. You learn from failure and trying again.  Organized : You know how to keep track of both high-level goals and the tasks required to meet those goals. You take personal ownership of your team’s success.  Our Senior Data Scientists will have some combination of the following:  Understanding of structure and theory of common machine learning models  Familiarity with common machine learning libraries for implementation (sklearn, weka, tensorflow, torch, …)  Proficiency in one or more of: Python, Scala, Java, R, Julia, Matlab  Expertise in a sub-field of machine learning (computer vision, natural language processing, ...)  Ability to understand and implement new models from the literature  Project team leadership  Experience presenting team progress and results  Technical writing experience, including reports and proposals  Experience with distributed analytics and processing (Spark, Hadoop, …)  Experience with geospatial data and analytics  Active TS security clearance  Familiarity with Agile development  Requirements  US citizenship required. We do not offer sponsorships.  Multiple years of experience as a data scientist, machine learning engineer, or similar role.  Benefits CCRi is a small engineering firm located in Charlottesville, Virginia. We develop and deploy novel machine-learning approaches to real problems at massive scale. Since 1992, we’ve been stopping bombs, predicting piracy, and guiding disaster relief.  Intellectually Challenging Work  Health Insurance  Short Term Disability Insurance  Generous Defined Benefit Retirement  Very Flexible Vacation Policy  Want to know more? Check out our recruitment video and blog.   The job description above is not intended to be comprehensive list. Responsibilities, activities, duties, and/or tasks may change or be assigned at any time. CCRi is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce because we know that our differences benefit our employees, our customers, and our community. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.
